## In `R`...

categorical variables can have either `character` *or* `factor` data types

</br>

. . .

`factor` -- structured & fixed number of levels / options

-   can be ordered or unordered

</br>

. . .

`character` -- unstructured & variable number of levels

-   is inherently unordered

## Incorporating Categorical Variables into Data Visualizations

::: incremental
-   As a variable on the `x`- or `y`-axis

-   As a `color` / `fill`

-   As a facet
:::

## Salamander Size

::: columns
::: {.column width="55%"}

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_2_mm)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 14) + 
  labs(x = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)")
```

## Faceted Histograms


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_1_mm)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 14) + 
  facet_wrap(~ section, scales = "free") +
  labs(x = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/facet-hist-1.png){width=95%}
:::
:::


What do you think `scales = "free"` does?

## Side-by-Side Boxplots

::: columns
::: {.column width="50"}

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_1_mm, 
                     y = species)
         ) + 
  geom_boxplot() + 
  labs(x = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)", 
       y = "Salamander Species") 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/horizontal-boxplot-1.png){fig-align='center' width=576}
:::
:::

:::

::: {.column width="50"}

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(y = length_1_mm, 
                     x = species)
         ) + 
  geom_boxplot() + 
  labs(y = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)", 
       x = "Salamander Species")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/vertical-boxplot-1.png){fig-align='center' width=576}

Which orientation do you prefer? Vertical or horizontal?

## Colors in Boxplots


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_1_mm, 
                       y = species, 
                       color = unittype)
         ) + 
  geom_boxplot() + 
  labs(x = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)", 
       y = "Salamander Species", 
       color = "Channel Type")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/boxplot-color-1.png){fig-align='center' width=80%}
:::
:::


::: {style="font-size: 0.5em;"}
Why are there only two boxplots for the Olympic torrent salamander?
:::

## Facets & Colors in Boxplots


::: {.cell layout-align="center" output-location='slide'}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_1_mm, 
                       y = species, 
                       color = section)
         ) + 
  geom_boxplot() + 
  facet_wrap(~ unittype) + 
  labs(x = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)", 
       y = "Salamander Species", 
       color = "Section in Mack Creek")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/boxplot-facets-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::


## Facets & Color in Scatterplots


::: {.cell layout-align="center" output-location='slide'}

```{.r .cell-code  code-line-numbers="false"}
ggplot(data = salamander, 
       mapping = aes(x = length_1_mm, 
                       y = weight_g, 
                       color = section)
         ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  facet_wrap(~species, scales = "free") +
  labs(y = "Snout to Tail Length (mm)", 
       x = "Year", 
       color = "Salamander Species")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](week3-day1-alt_files/figure-revealjs/scatterplot-facets-1.png){fig-align='center' width=960}
:::
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
